meanings.definition: In poor condition; shabby or dilapidated.
meanings.sent1: The old, rattiest chair in the room creaked when sat on.
meanings.sent2: The house on the corner looked the rattiest with its peeling paint and broken windows.
meanings.sent3: Despite its rattiest appearance, the little shack had a cozy feel to it.
meanings.sent4: The rattiest building in town stood as a reminder of neglect and time's toll.
meanings.sent5: The rattiest blanket in the attic was still the warmest on a chilly night.

meanings.sent1: The cafeteria served the rattiest food imaginable, making everyone cringe.
meanings.sent2: The alley behind the market was the rattiest place in the neighborhood, filled with garbage and rats.
meanings.sent3: The rattiest outfit she wore to the party turned heads for all the wrong reasons.
meanings.sent4: The rattiest smell from the dumpster made even the bravest hold their noses.
meanings.sent5: The rattiest sound of nails on a chalkboard echoed through the classroom.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a rat.
meanings.sent1: The rattiest behavior of the rodents surprised the researchers.
meanings.sent2: The attic was infested with the rattiest creatures, scurrying around at night.
meanings.sent3: The rattiest squeak came from the smallest rat in the group.
meanings.sent4: The rattiest fur on the rat made it stand out among the others.
meanings.sent5: The rattiest footprints led the exterminator straight to the nest.
